capstone.utility

Class Pattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • capstone.utility.Pattern
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Delta>

    public class Pattern
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Delta>
    A Pattern is a finite set of deltas that a PatternObstacle moves by.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(java.lang.String pattern)
        Constructs a pattern from one of the allowed pattern Strings. Basically, instead of writing `new Delta(-1, 0)` for going left, you can write "l". That's my kind of convenience. Alternatively, if the manhattan distance is greater 1, you can also write the coordinates directly, i.e. "(-1, 0)". The regex just looks for two numbers separated by a one or more non-digit characters, so you're free to format them however you wish. Examples of allowed patterns: l = LEFT r = RIGHT u = UP d = DOWN (x, y) x y x, y [x, y] (x y) sdfasdflasfadsfdfa x asfjksdfjls y as;fkasirjlnafnrlf
        Parameters:
        pattern - The pattern string.

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(Delta... pattern)
        Constructs a Pattern from an array of Deltas.
        Parameters:
        pattern - An array of deltas. Must be at least one.

      • Pattern

        public Pattern(java.util.Collection<Delta> pattern)
        Constructs a Pattern from a collection of Deltas.
        Parameters:
        pattern - the collection of deltas. Must be non-empty.

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public Point apply(Point point)
        Applies the current delta in the pattern to the given point, without moving to the next Delta in the pattern.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to apply the Delta to.
        Returns:
        The resulting point (same one that is passed and modified).
        See Also:
        safeApply(capstone.utility.Point, capstone.utility.Region)

      • next

        public Point next(Point point)
        Applies the current delta in the pattern to the given point and moves to the next Delta in the pattern after.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to apply the Delta to.
        Returns:
        The resulting point (same one that is passed and modified).
        See Also:
        safeNext(capstone.utility.Point, capstone.utility.Region)

      • previous

        public Point previous(Point point)
        Applies the current delta in the pattern to the given point and moves to the previous Delta in the pattern after.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to apply the Delta to.
        Returns:
        The resulting point (same one that is passed and modified).
        See Also:
        safePrevious(capstone.utility.Point, capstone.utility.Region)

      • safeApply

        public Point safeApply(Point point,
                       Region region)
        Performs apply() only if the resulting point does not go outside the region.
        Parameters:
        point - The point to apply the Delta to, if it's safe.
        region - The region the point should not trespass.
        Returns:
        The resulting point (same one that is passed and modified).

      • safeNext

        public Point safeNext(Point point,
                      Region region)
        Performs next() only if the resulting point does not go outside the region.
        Parameters:

        region - The region the point should not trespass.
        Returns:
        The resulting point (same one that is passed and modified).

        Returns:

        Parameters:

      • skip

        public void skip(int steps)
        Skips the given number of steps in the pattern. The number of steps can be negative and its absolute value greater than the pattern. An absolute value greater than the pattern is like looping multiple times backward or forward until the steps are zero.
        Parameters:
        steps - The number of steps to skip.

      • skip

        public void skip()
        Skips one step forward in the pattern.

      • index

        public int index()
        Returns:
        The current index of the pattern.

      • peek

        public Delta peek()
        Equivalent to at(index())
        Returns:
        Returns the current delta in the pattern.

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns:
        The length of the pattern (number of steps).

        private Delta _parseDelta(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)
        Handles matching one Delta in a pattern-string.

      • _parseCoordinates

        private Delta _parseCoordinates(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)
        Parses a coordinate, i.e. pattern with an x and y component, as opposed to the characters 'l','r,'u' and 'd' that are also valid patterns.
        Parameters:
        matcher - The Matcher object holding the last match.
        Returns:
        The resulting Delta.

      • _parseCharacter

        private Delta _parseCharacter(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher)
        Parses a character, i.e. one of the characters 'l','r,'u' or 'd'.
        Parameters:
        matcher - The Matcher object holding the last match.
        Returns:
        The resulting Delta.

      • _addDeltas

        private void _addDeltas(java.util.regex.Matcher matcher,
                        java.util.Collection<Delta> collection,
                        Delta delta)
        Handles one match in full delta pattern. Basically adds the last-parsed Delta a certain number of times. That number of times is either retrieved from the first group of the regular expression (it's even named "count", wooh!), or is 1 if that group is null.
        Parameters:
        matcher - The Matcher object holding the last match.
        collection - The current collection of Deltas.
        delta - The next Delta.
